timeline.bodyText: This is not needed since we bumped it to 4.6 at the start of 5.2.0.
timeline.author: bjhargrave

replies.bodyText: There is a minor quirk in the baselining that misled me into making this change - I renamed a method. The newly-named method was requesting a minor version increment. What I didn't notice (at first) was that there was another baseline error at the class level flagging the removal of the old name and requesting a major version increment. I think ideally, in this situation, given that the minor version had already been incremented, the error flagging minor version increment should be suppressed and only the error flagging major version increment should be reported.
replies.author: kriegfrj

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/biz.aQute.bndlib/src/aQute/bnd/osgi/package-info.java b/biz.aQute.bndlib/src/aQute/bnd/osgi/package-info.java
index 7e091272c..ad034a865 100644
--- a/biz.aQute.bndlib/src/aQute/bnd/osgi/package-info.java
+++ b/biz.aQute.bndlib/src/aQute/bnd/osgi/package-info.java

@@ -1,4 +1,4 @@
-@Version("4.7.0")
+@Version("4.6.0")
 package aQute.bnd.osgi;
 
 import org.osgi.annotation.versioning.Version;

timeline.message:
[classindex] Properly handle binary class name

Fixes #4289.

Signed-off-by: Fr Jeremy Krieg <fr.jkrieg@greekwelfaresa.org.au>

[classindex] Properly handle binary class name

Fixes #4289.

Signed-off-by: Fr Jeremy Krieg <fr.jkrieg@greekwelfaresa.org.au>
